Title: sweetgreen
Address: 3070 Washtenaw Ave Suite D107, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Locavore-friendly counter-serve chain specializing in organic salads & bowls.

summary.snippet: "I got takeout but the restaurant is clean and staff is friendly and personable."
"Pretty good salad, liked the crispy rice and the dressing that came with it"

most_relevant.description: Picked up a Chicken Ceaser Salad from Sweet Greens.  Fresh lime juice and dressing were added, preceding the salad being tossed, and bread was served with the meal.  The salad tasted good. I split the salad with someone else, we ordered it as carry-out. The business was in a shopping area with businesses like Anthropologie and Lululemon. There was an outdoor seating area that was not directly attached to Sweet Greens. The food looked fresh.

Awful Food! Pre ious order was great . Tonight 9/23.2024 Terrible! We ordered 3 bowls the Salmon was the size of a sardine and almost 20.00, the blackened chicken no sauce , the sweet potatoes were dry and wrinkled, the rice was like glue, the veg slaw had about 4 carrots and the brussel sprouts looked like maybe kale greens and burnt. The steak bowl the meat was gray. We took them back for a remake and asked for the manager, and He refused to come from the back and address our concerns. They remade them and told us  that the all the brussel sprouts looked like that tonight. The second remake was just as bad as the first. The taste was of charred burnt food. This is way too expensive to put out poor quality food like this. Save Your money this is awful

I ordered a create your own bowl with chicken, rice, and an egg. This is what I got. I think the picture speaks for itself. Terrible service. I will not be ordering from Sweetgreen or recommending them to anyone.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at the new Sweetgreen location in the Arbor Hills shopping plaza, and I must say, it was an absolute delight! This salad shop brings a fresh and invigorating experience to the area, combining an outdoor eating area with a commitment to local farmers and sourcing ingredients.

The moment I stepped inside, I was greeted by a vibrant atmosphere that exuded a sense of warmth and creativity. The outdoor eating area was a breath of fresh air, providing a relaxing ambiance that made my dining experience all the more enjoyable.

Sweetgreen's dedication to sourcing local ingredients shines through in every dish. Their menu boasts an impressive selection of fresh, flavorful, made-from-scratch bowls, plates, sides, and more. It's evident that each ingredient is carefully chosen and thoughtfully prepared. The result is a culinary journey that highlights the true essence of locally sourced goodness.

What truly sets Sweetgreen apart is their commitment to prepping ingredients from scratch each day. This dedication to freshness and quality is evident in every bite. From the crispness of the greens to the vibrant flavors that burst with every mouthful, each dish is a testament to their unwavering passion for delivering exceptional food.

Not only is Sweetgreen a haven for salad enthusiasts, but they also cater to a variety of dietary preferences and restrictions. Their menu offers a wide range of options, ensuring there's something for everyone. Whether you're a devoted carnivore or a dedicated vegan, Sweetgreen has you covered.

The friendly and knowledgeable staff and Maddie who was helping me at Sweetgreen further elevated the dining experience. They are always ready to provide recommendations, answer questions, and make your visit a memorable one. Their passion for the food they serve is infectious, and it's clear they genuinely care about delivering an outstanding experience to their customers.

If you're in the Arbor Hills area and crave a fresh and fulfilling meal, I wholeheartedly recommend Sweetgreen. With their dedication to locally sourced ingredients, made-from-scratch preparations, and an inviting outdoor eating area, Sweetgreen is a true gem in the salad scene. Go ahead and treat your taste buds to an unforgettable experience!

Disclaimer: This review is based on my personal experience and taste preferences. Individual experiences may vary.

I made a mistake in my order and they took care of me! So I would say they gave  excellent customer service by the manager (didn’t catch their name) 8/27 @ 7:50p. The food is the best!! It’s so fresh and tasty!!!! I got takeout but the restaurant is clean and staff is friendly and personable. I love it, have ordered a lot of different meals—all amazing, and will keep coming back!!!

I probably get sweetgreen about once a week. One of my favorite spots for healthy food, and the dressings are addictively good. That being said this location is awesome when you go inside and order at the counter, but if you order pickup ahead of time in the app, or order delivery, 10/10 times your bowl will be disappointing with multiple missing ingredients and very small portions compared to when you order in shop. It’s a big bummer because the convenience of ordering ahead in the app and picking up on your way home is such a plus.

Edited to add that they started adding an automatic tip to your purchase in-store. I am happy to tip for table service. Being tricked into tipping for counter service and disposable dishes feels wrong. Just pay your staff.

I got hired as a dishwasher for sweetgreen. I was struggling a little to keep up with the work expectations and was promised three weeks to improve during my probationary period. I was fired over text the following day.

Don't waste your money on a business that doesn't even respect their employees or their own word. I thought my grass was greener working here only to be betrayed and disappointed in the management of this overpriced salad 🥗 joint.

P.s my stalker put hidden cameras in the bathrooms to stalk me at work, it's your problem now. I suggest you get the police involved cus I'm never stepping in a sweetgreen again from working there.

Healthy fast food is a thing? Well it is here in sweetgreen. Delicious too!? Whats the catch? Online ordering is horrid, bowls missing main ingredients etc (Shroomami with no mushrooms? Wtf). If you go in youre good tho. A bit pricey but then again there aren't many healthy alternatives so I love with it.
